item.title: Cortex Data Lake - Issue in Gov
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Cortex Data Lake Issue for US Government Customers

Delays in log processing due to TLS certificate issues. Summary: Cortex Data Lake is currently experiencing an issue affecting US Government Customers. There are delays in log processing due to TLS certificate issues. An update will be provided by 19:00 UTC.

Mar 4, 18:05 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Mar 4, 17:57 UTC
Investigating - Cortex Data Lake is currently experiencing an issue affecting US Government Customers. We are actively working on this issue and will provide another update by 19:00 UTC with further details.

Customer Impact: Delays in log processing due to TLS certificate issues

Workaround: N/A

item.title: Intermittent Delays and failures in machines allocation for tenants
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Machine Allocation Delays and Failures

Selective tenants are experiencing intermittent machine allocation delays and failures due to a configuration issue. Investigative work is ongoing to resolve the problem.

Mar 2, 08:11 UTC
Update - We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

Mar 2, 08:10 UTC
Identified - A selective tenants will witness machine allocation delays and failures intermittently.

Timeline:

10:30 AM PDT: Intermittent Machine allocation failures noticed in the monitoring system
10.45 AM PDT: Investigation in progress

item.title: IoT Security (Government) Scheduled Maintenance
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - IoT Security Maintenance

The IoT Security (Government) service will undergo maintenance to the data warehouse, potentially causing intermittent portal loading issues and temporary data delays. No action is required, and status updates will be provided throughout the maintenance period. Reach out to IoT Security technical support for any questions or concerns.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 1, 21:00 - 23:00 UTC

Mar 1, 17:30 UTC
Scheduled - WHAT: IoT Security (Government) plan to carry on an maintenance on data warehouse service, which hosts the IoT Security product.

WHEN: Friday, Mar 1 | 1:00 PM PST - 3:00 PM PST

WHERE: Government region

NO ACTION REQUIRED

IMPACT: A small fraction of customers might have intermittent portal loading issues or temporary data delays. Please ignore inspector offline alerts during the maintenance.

SUPPORT: We will provide status updates before and throughout the maintenance. If you have any questions or concerns, feel free to reach out to IoT Security technical support at iot-security@paloaltonetworks.com.

item.title: Prisma Access is experiencing performance degradation in Turkey region
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Service Degradation in Turkey Cloud Provider/ISP

We are experiencing service degradation within the cloud provider/ISP reportedly in Turkey that can potentially cause performance issues for certain Prisma Access customers within that region. We are currently looking into the impact and working very closely with the cloud provider to investigate it further.

Mar 1, 14:09 UTC
Investigating - We are experiencing service degradation within the cloud provider/ISP reportedly in Turkey that can potentially cause performance issues for certain Prisma Access customers within that region.
We are currently looking into the impact and working very closely with the cloud provider to investigate it further. The next update will be provided by March 1st 16:00 UTC

Feb 29, 21:07 UTC
Scheduled - We have a planned service maintenance for Prisma Cloud in the France region scheduled for March 4 2024 from 22:00 UTC to 23:00 UTC.

During this scheduled maintenance, customers may experience intermittent failures across services as they get upgraded.

item.title: The 90 day unique user count within Strata Cloud Manager reflects a value of 0 for a few customers
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Configuration Change Causing Prisma Access License Entitlement Issue

On Feb 17, 2024, a configuration change to the license entitlement for MU from 90 days to 30 days across all Prisma Access customers led to an incompatibility with some Strata Cloud Manager managed tenants. This resulted in a zero unique user count within the Managed and workflow pages. The Prisma Access Engineering and SRE teams are actively working to resolve this issue for affected customers. Next update expected by Feb 29, 2024, 11 PM UTC.

Feb 29, 18:34 UTC
Identified - On the weekend of Feb 17 2024, license entitlement for MU was changed from 90 days to 30 days across all the Prisma Access customers. This change caused incompatibility with some of the Strata Cloud Manager managed tenants, resulting in the 90 day unique user count within the Managed pages and the workflow pages to reflect a zero value.

The Prisma Access Engineering team and the SRE team are working towards addressing this issue for the affected customers. The next update will be shared by Feb 29 2024, 11 PM UTC.

item.title: Scheduled Maintenance Status Notification
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Scheduled Maintenance Activity on March 1st

Regular maintenance activity is scheduled for Friday, 1st March from 5:00 PM to 9:00 PM PST. There may be some performance degradation for RBI service during this time. No other services will be impacted.

Feb 29, 05:25 UTC
Investigating - We would be implementing a regular maintenance activity to enhance our services, which is a scheduled maintenance window on Friday, 1st March, from 5:00 PM to 9:00 PM PST. Additionally, please note that RBI service may face some performance degradation while this regular maintenance activity is underway. We appreciate your understanding and cooperation. Stay informed with real-time updates at sase.status.paloaltonetworks.com. No other services will be impacted during this maintenance window.

item.title: IoT Security (US) Scheduled Maintenance
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - Maintenance Update Summary: IoT Security (US) plan to carry out an upgrade maintenance on AWS EKS service, which hosts the IoT Security product. A small fraction of US customers might have intermittent portal loading issues or temporary data delays. Please ignore inspector offline alerts during the maintenance. We will provide status updates before and throughout the maintenance. If you have any questions or concerns, feel free to reach out to IoT Security technical support at iot-security@paloaltonetworks.com.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Feb 28, 23:00 UTC  -  Feb 29, 07:00 UTC

Feb 26, 18:57 UTC
Scheduled - WHAT: IoT Security (US) plan to carry on an upgrade maintenance on AWS EKS service, which hosts the IoT Security product.

WHEN: Wednesday, Feb 28 | 3:00 PM PST - 11:00 PM PST

WHERE: US region

NO ACTION REQUIRED

IMPACT: A small fraction of US customers might have intermittent portal loading issues or temporary data delays. Please ignore inspector offline alerts during the maintenance.

SUPPORT: We will provide status updates before and throughout the maintenance. If you have any questions or concerns, feel free to reach out to IoT Security technical support at iot-security@paloaltonetworks.com.

Cortex XSOAR 8.5 is still accessible and functional for all other use cases.

item.title: Strata Cloud Management commits are erroring
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Validation Errors in 'Strata Cloud Manager'

Palo Alto Engineering is investigating validation errors when committing changes using 'Strata Cloud Manager'. An update is expected by 9 AM UTC.

Feb 26, 05:52 UTC
Investigating - Customers may see some validation errors when committing changes using 'Strata Cloud Manager'. Palo Alto Engineering is investigating and will have an update by 9 AM UTC

item.title: Prisma Cloud Compute emergency maintenance
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Scheduled Maintenance: Prisma Cloud Compute Console Upgrade

Summary: The Prisma Cloud Compute team will be performing an emergency maintenance patch to upgrade the Compute console to version 32.03.123. Customers may experience intermittent failures across services during the patch update, but downtime is expected to be minimal.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Feb 25, 22:15 - 23:45 UTC

Feb 25, 22:00 UTC
Scheduled - WHAT:
The Prisma Cloud Compute team will perform an emergency maintenance patch on Compute console.
The Compute console will be upgraded to version 32.03.123.

WHEN:
Feb 25th, 2024 from 10:15 PM UTC to 11:45 PM UTC.

IMPACT:
During the maintenance, customers may experience intermittent failures across services as they get patched. It's a rolling patch update, and the Prisma cloud compute consoles are expected to be down only for a few minutes.

For any issues with the Prisma Cloud Compute, please reach out to the Palo alto networks Prisma Cloud support team.

item.title: Prisma Cloud Compute (Twistlock) is experiencing partial outage for limited tenants
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Investigating Summary: The company is currently investigating an issue. No indication of major impact or downtime as of now.

Feb 25, 13:41 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

item.title: Issues with syncing user id and group information with Cloud Identity Engine
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Prisma Access Notification Sync Issue

Prisma Access Engineering team is aware of issues in notifications impacting the sync of users and groups with Cloud Identity Engine for customers who have between Feb 23 11:55 PM UTC and Feb 24 01:20 AM UTC. The issue impacts Cortex Data Lake onboarded in Americas, causing delays in syncing user and user group information within the Prisma Access Mobile User Gateways and Remote Networks.

Feb 24, 02:35 UTC
Identified - The Prisma Access Engineering team is aware of issues in notifications impacting the sync of users and groups with Cloud Identity Engine for customers who have between Feb 23 11:55 PM UTC and Feb 24 01:20 AM UTC and are actively working to resolve them.

This issue impacts customers whose Cortex Data Lake is onboarded in Americas and given this issue, the users and user group information retrieved/learnt between Feb 23 11:55 PM UTC and Feb 24 01:20 AM UTC will have delays in syncing, within the Prisma Access Mobile User Gateways and Remote Networks.

Our team is committed to restoring full functionality as swiftly as possible and is taking all necessary steps to address this matter.
The next update will be shared by Feb 24, 09:00 AM UTC

item.title: Advanced Threat Prevention (ATP) - Scheduled Maintenance - Global / All Regions
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Planned Service Maintenance

Summary: Advanced Threat Prevention service will undergo maintenance on March 14th, 2024, potentially causing intermittent disconnects across all regions.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 14, 23:00 UTC  -  Mar 15, 03:00 UTC

Feb 23, 05:43 UTC
Scheduled - We have a planned service maintenance for Advanced Threat Prevention on March 14th, 2024 from 23:00 UTC to March 15th, 2024 03:00 UTC. The service maintenance will affect globally / all regions.

Customer Impact: During this scheduled maintenance, customers may experience intermittent disconnects across services as they get upgraded.

item.title: Scheduled Maintenance for Cortex XDR / XSIAM / XSOAR 8 / XPANSE in America Government Region
item.content:encoded:
High - Service Maintenance Scheduled for Cortex XDR, XSIAM, XSOAR 8, XPANSE Summary: Maintenance scheduled for March 3rd, 2024 from 08:00 AM to 03:00 PM UTC in America Government region. Service may be unavailable for a maximum of 30 minutes.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 3, 08:00 - 15:00 UTC

Feb 18, 10:24 UTC
Scheduled - We are planning a service maintenance for Cortex XDR / XSIAM / XSOAR 8 / XPANSE in America Government region. The maintenance is scheduled for March 3rd 2024 from 08:00 AM UTC to 03:00 PM UTC March 3rd 2024. During this window, the service may be unavailable for a maximum of 30 minutes. However, if you are experiencing unusual activity in your environment, please contact our Support - https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/company/contact-support.

item.title: Scheduled Maintenance for Cortex XDR / XSIAM / XSOAR 8 / XPANSE in Europe, Germany, Switzerland, Poland, Qatar and United Kingdom Regions
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Service Maintenance for Cortex XDR / XSIAM / XSOAR 8 / XPANSE in Europe

Summary: Scheduled maintenance is planned for various regions in Europe, with a potential maximum 30-minute service unavailability window during the specified time frame. If unusual activity is experienced, users are advised to contact support.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Feb 25, 15:00 UTC  -  Feb 26, 00:00 UTC

Feb 8, 10:14 UTC
Scheduled - We are planning a service maintenance for Cortex XDR / XSIAM / XSOAR 8 / XPANSE in Europe, Germany, Switzerland, Poland, Qatar and United Kingdom regions. The maintenance is scheduled for February 25th 2024 from 15:00 UTC to 00:00 UTC February 26th 2024. During this window, the service may be unavailable for a maximum of 30 minutes. However, if you are experiencing unusual activity in your environment, please contact our Support - https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/company/contact-support.

item.title: Prisma Cloud Compute Scheduled Release - O’Neal Update 3 (32.03)
item.content:encoded:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Feb 25, 07:00 - 11:00 UTC

Feb 13, 09:32 UTC
Scheduled - We have a planned minor upgrade for Prisma Cloud Compute to O’Neal Update 3 (32.03) version in the following regions, scheduled for February 25, 2024 from 07:00AM UTC to 11:00AM UTC.

Customers may experience intermittent failures in the Compute feature set during this scheduled maintenance. No other Prisma Cloud Services will be affected.

For more information about the release, please refer to the
Look Ahead—Planned Updates on Prisma Cloud Compute

All data ingestion is unaffected as well.
